alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 03 at 8:46AM MDT until June 04 at 11:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Great Falls MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Montana... Clear Creek at Chinook affecting Blaine County. For the Clear Creek...including Chinook...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clear Creek at Chinook. * WHEN...From this morning to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet water comes out of its banks and affects ranches near the creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM MDT Saturday was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will crest this afternoon around 6.5 feet and then likely fall below flood stage on Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM MDT.
